meanings.def: a person who invites guests to a meal, a party, etc. or who has people staying at their house
examples: Ian, our host, introduced us to the other guests.
Sonja stayed with an Argentine host family.

meanings.def: a country, a city or an organization that holds and arranges a special event
examples: the host nation/country/city
host to somebody/something The college is playing host to a group of visiting Russian scientists.
The wonderful city of Melbourne is host to this event.
The host club is to be congratulated on its organization of the tournament.
The town is playing host to a film crew.

meanings.def: a person who introduces a television or radio show, and talks to guests
examples: a radio/TV host
The event will be opened by television host Bill Punter.

meanings.def: an animal or a plant on which another animal or plant lives and feeds
a large number of people or things
examples: a host of possibilities
Lavender oil can relieve a whole host of ailments.

meanings.def: the main computer in a network that controls or supplies information to other computers that are connected to it
examples: transferring files from the host to your local computer

meanings.def: the bread that is used in the Christian service of communion, after it has been blessed
to be a place where a particular plant, animal or feature is found
examples: Australia is host to some of the world's most dangerous animals.
The acre of garden is host to a splendid bank of rhododendrons.
The park is host to a beautiful ornamental lake.

idioms.def: to be a place where a particular plant, animal or feature is found
examples: Australia is host to some of the world's most dangerous animals.
The acre of garden is host to a splendid bank of rhododendrons.
The park is host to a beautiful ornamental lake.

meanings.def: to organize an event to which others are invited and make all the arrangements for them
examples: to host an event/a conference/a meeting
South Africa hosted the World Cup finals.
Birmingham is hosting a three-day conference on drugs.
The Arts Centre is hosting a folk festival this summer.
The country is very keen to host the Winter Olympics in six years' time.
The tournament is to be jointly hosted by India, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.
the city's bid to host the Olympic Games in the year 2008

meanings.def: to introduce a television or radio programme, a show, etc.
examples: Charlie Rose will host tonight's show.

meanings.def: to organize a party that you have invited guests to
examples: to host a dinner
The President hosted a banquet in her honour.
Whose turn is it to host?

meanings.def: to store a website on a computer connected to the internet, usually in return for payment
examples: a company that builds and hosts e-commerce sites
